channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Mum hit by car at Denbighshire festival as daughter, 2, thrown to safety
item.description: "I genuinely believed my whole family had died", says Jenna O'Neill, who suffered serious injuries.

item.title: Pub beer garden crash man 'happy to be alive'
item.description: Darren George, 30, remains in hospital after a car crashed into a pub beer garden.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Shielding will not be used again, top doctor says
item.description: The Welsh government says it will not ask 130,000 vulnerable people to isolate at home in future.

item.title: David Jones death: Man jailed for nine years for manslaughter
item.description: David John Jones died in hospital after he was assaulted in Holyhead, in November.

item.title: Bute Park attack: Girl, 16, held on suspicion of attempted murder
item.description: Two men have already appeared in court after a man received life-threatening injuries in an attack.

item.title: Lumberjack out of sight when tree crushed him to death
item.description: Ben Thomas died at work when a tree fell on him as he cleared wood from a forest.

item.title: Cardigan murder: Accused in court as man stabbed seven times
item.description: Ashley Keegan appears in court charged with murdering John Bell in Cardigan.

item.title: Brexit: The Walnut Tree temporarily closes because of 'staff shortage'
item.description: A well-known Welsh restaurant has temporarily closed because of a "staff shortage".

item.title: Sunburn and back pain among non-emergency 999 calls
item.description: One person called 999 to say they were unable to go to the toilet, the ambulance service says.

item.title: A487 Porthmadog crash: Van driver airlifted to hospital
item.description: Police were called to the A487 on Tuesday, with the other driver believed to have minor injuries.

item.title: Sea scooter riders 'face barrage of criticism'
item.description: TV presenter Iolo Williams had reported seeing riders plough through sea birds off the Welsh coast.

item.title: BAME teacher shortage at 'crisis point' in Wales
item.description: A shortage of role models could be one of the reasons why there is a lack, says one new teacher.

item.title: World War Two Arctic Convoys veteran given Royal Navy funeral
item.description: Alan Higgins honoured after surviving being torpedoed, the D-Day landings and World War Two.

item.title: Black representation: ‘I never saw a teacher who looked like me’
item.description: Natalie Jones says teaching did not seem like a possible career choice for her.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Williams' family celebrate silver medal success
item.description: Lauren Williams' sister proud of Tokyo 2020 taekwondo runner-up as family cheer on Welsh star.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Williams takes taekwondo silver for Great Britain
item.description: Great Britain's Lauren Williams takes silver in the women's -67kg taekwondo after losing the final to Croatia's Matea Jelic at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Taff's Well allotments 'sabotage' leaves gardeners angry
item.description: Gardeners believe a saboteur is holding a grudge against the allotments after a spate of vandalism.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'I put too much pressure on myself' - Jade Jones on shock taekwondo exit
item.description: Two-time Olympic taekwondo champion Jade Jones discusses her shock defeat to Kimia Alizadeh of the Refugee Olympic Team in the first round of the women's -57kg tournament.

item.title: Bryn wind farm: Calls to withdraw 250m-high turbines plan
item.description: Residents fear the 250m high turbines would pose risks to wildlife, property values and health.

item.title: British & Irish Lions: Warren Gatland makes three changes for second Lions Test
item.description: British and Irish Lions name squad for second South Africa test - with Mako Vunipola, Conor Murray and Chris Harris starting.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Dean takes gold, plus silvers for Duncan Scott and Georgia Taylor-Brown
item.description: Tom Dean takes gold ahead of compatriot Duncan Scott as Great Britain makes its best ever start to an Olympics.

item.title: The Hundred: Welsh Fire fans upset by late ticket cancellations at Sophia Gardens
item.description: Cricket fans are left frustrated after 1,000 tickets were cancelled just days before Welsh Fire's first home game in Cardiff.

item.title: Women's Olympic football: Team GB top group after late draw with Canada
item.description: Great Britain top Group E following a late equaliser against Canada in the women's football tournament at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Lauren Williams wins silver in -67kg taekwondo
item.description: Great Britain's Lauren Williams takes silver in the -67kg taekwondo at Tokyo 2020 after being beaten by Matea Jelic of Croatia in the final.

item.title: Dyn yn y llys ar gyhuddiad o lofruddio yn Aberteifi
item.description: Cafodd John Williams Bell, 37, ei ddarganfod ar y ffordd i Bont Aberteifi yn oriau mân 21 Gorffennaf.

item.title: Cleifion 'yn gaeth' yn ysbytai Gwynedd achos diffyg gofalwyr
item.description: Mae dros 20 o bobl yn methu gadael ysbytai yn Nhremadog a Bangor oherwydd diffyg gofalwyr, meddai gwleidydd lleol.

item.title: Naw mlynedd o garchar am ddynladdiad yng Nghaergybi
item.description: Cyfaddefodd Gareth Wyn Jones ddynladdiad David John Jones, ac fe gafodd ddedfryd ychwanegol am drosedd gyffuriau.

item.title: Beth sy'n digwydd yn Eisteddfod 2021?
item.description: Sut allwch chi ddilyn y Brifwyl eleni?

item.title: Tri newid i'r Llewod ar gyfer yr ail gêm brawf
item.description: Conor Murray, Chris Harris a Mako Vunipola yn dechrau, gyda'r Cymro, Taulupe Faletau ar y fainc.
